üö® Important Notice! üö® It has come to our attention that certain websites and individuals are presenting false information about admission into Lead City University, including cut-off marks and admission requirements. Please note that these are NOT official Lead City University pages. We encourage everyone to be cautious when interacting with such pages. Always verify information through our official channels. üëâ To apply for admission online, visit: admissions.lcu.edu.ng. Help us spread the word by sharing this post and creating awareness to protect prospective students from scams. #LeadCityUniversity #LCU #Admissions #StaySafe #CreateAwareness

üåç Happy Nelson Mandela Day! üåç Today, we celebrate the life and legacy of Nelson Mandela, a global icon of peace, justice, and human rights. At Lead City University, we are inspired by his unwavering commitment to equality and freedom for all. Let us all take a moment to reflect on his values and dedicate ourselves to making the world a better place through acts of kindness and service. #NelsonMandelaDay #LeadCityUniversity #Peace #Justice #HumanRights #Inspiration #MandelaLegacy

We are thrilled to announce that The Medical and Dental Council of Nigeria (MDCN) has accredited the Medicine & Surgery (MBBS) programme at Lead City University. This official recognition underscores our commitment to delivering exceptional medical education and training, ensuring our students are equipped with the skills and knowledge to excel in their health care careers. Lead City University remains dedicated to fostering excellence in healthcare education and contributing to the development of a healthier society. Come Study with us Today! #leadcityuniversity #collegeofmedicine #medicineandsurgery #fullyaccredited

Still in the spirit of World Youth Skills Day, here are some more works from our amazing students, Taiwo and Kimberly, both 200-level Mass Communication students. Taiwo created this fantastic animation for his class homework after learning prop animation, sound effects, scene joining, and rendering techniques in our current animation class. Kimberly also produced an amazing animation using the same skills learned in the Mass Communication Department. These projects showcase the power of youth skills in bringing creative ideas to life. At Lead City University, we are committed to equipping our students with the skills they need to thrive in today‚Äôs world. Check out the incredible work of our students and celebrate the potential of youth skills! Discover your potential in media and communication. Apply now to be part of our dynamic learning community and gain hands-on experience like Taiwo and Kimberly! Trainer: My PC Softwares YouTube: YouTube.com/MyPCsofts #WorldYouthSkillsDay #LeadCityUniversity #YouthSkills #Animation #MassCommunication

Happy World Youth Skills Day! On this special day, we celebrate the vital role of equipping young people with skills for employment, decent work, and entrepreneurship. The theme for this year is "Youth Skills for Peace and Development," highlighting the crucial role youth play in peacebuilding and conflict resolution. At Lead City University, we proudly support this mission, believing that #SkillsChangeLives. Through the power of skills, individuals, communities, and countries are propelled towards a more prosperous future. Therefore, all our students take 2 vocational skill courses during their 2nd and 3rd years, choosing from a diverse range of almost 100 skills‚Äîfrom crafts and cooking to robotics and cosmetics and beauty. We call our graduates "Enterprise Graduates," promoting skills for peace and development. Do you want to reach your full potential as an agent of peace and gain skills and opportunities to contribute to a peaceful, prosperous, and sustainable future? Then apply to join us at Lead City University! #WorldYouthSkillsDay #PeaceAndDevelopment #LeadCityUniversity #SustainableFuture

The Pro-Chancellor, Lead City University, Professor 'Jide Owoeye, warmly welcomed Bishop Felix Owolabi, Founder of Faith Triumph Ministries International and Bishop Felix Owolabi International Academy, and his wife, Dr Mrs Temitayo Owolabi to Lead City University on Wednesday 19th June 2024. The team, led by Bishop Felix Owolabi, visited the University to learn from Lead City University‚Äôs success story as they are in the process of prospecting for a University licence. On the Bishop‚Äôs entourage were Dr Tunde Adedotun, Dean, Faculty of Environmental Sciences, Osun State University and Chairman Planning and Implementation Committee of Proposed Owolabi University, Oke-Ila Orangun, Osun State; Pastor Adesayo Agbolade, Chief of Staff to Bishop Felix Owolabi and Dr. Femi Adefila, Chairman, Rave FM and Western Sun TV. At the meeting, Professor Owoeye assured the team that Lead City University is ready and willing to support in any way possible. After the visit, the team, accompanied by Lead City University‚Äôs Deputy Registrar, Academic Planning, Dr Ade Adewole were taken on a drive-through tour of the university by the Head of Marketing Mrs Deborah Adejobi. They expressed their appreciation and gave a good impression of what they saw and heard. We look forward to seeing the birth and the growth of the proposed Owolabi university and we are poised to play a role in this journey.

üåç Happy World Population Day! üåç Did you know? Lead City University is proud to have over 15,000 alumni making a difference around the world! As we celebrate World Population Day, we recognize the importance of counting everyone and ensuring every individual has the opportunity to reach their full potential. Today, let's commit to building a world where everyone is seen and valued. Together, we can create a future that leaves no one behind. #WorldPopulationDay #LeadCityUniversity #LCUAlumni #GlobalImpact #EveryoneCounts #LeaveNoOneBehind

Congratulations to our outstanding members of staff selected to participate in the 4C by 4C Change Challenge Academy at the Nigerian Institute of Medical Research (NIMR) in collaboration with Washington University in St. Louis, and The University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill! This prestigious opportunity focuses on enhancing participants' skills in implementing evidence-based research to combat cancer in Nigeria. The selected teams will lead pioneering research aimed at increasing the uptake of HPV and HBV vaccines within communities in Nigeria. Using a project-based approach to Dissemination and Implementation Science, they will design impactful community interventions. The Change Academy will be held from July 8 to July 21, 2024, and we are proud to announce that of the 5 total teams in the Academy, Lead City University has two teams participating: Team I (Team Activate Nigeria) 1. Dr. Folahanmi Akinsolu 2. Dr. Sophia Adeyeye 3. Dr. Posi Aduroja, PhD 4. Dr. Kehinde Lateef 5. Dr. Oluwatosin Ologbosere Ph.D Team II (Team Success) 1. Dr. Olajumoke Nwaechefu 2. Dr. Ayobola Sonuga 3. Dr. Jacinta N. Nwogu 4. Dr. Idayat Akinwumi 5. Dr. Opeyemi Akinmurele We wish them great success in this vital mission to improve public health through research and community engagement. #LeadCityUniversity #4CChangeChallenge #NIMR #CancerResearch #HPVVaccine #HBVVaccine #PublicHealth #TeamActivateNigeria #TeamSuccess
